Thornton and Ross , Huddersfield  — Assistant  Project Engineer  
JULY 2017 - MAY 2019 
Engineering internship in the Project Engineering department at Thornton and Ross’s 
pharmaceutical manufacturing & packaging factory.  Working as project lead on equipment 
installation projects  through the full project lifecycle  in addition to  process improvement 
projects.  Worked part time during my final year of studies assisting the project managers in 
delivering critical business proj ects and implementing a thorough project management 
structure as part of my university thesis.   
 
EDUCATION  
University of Huddersfield  — BEng (Hons) Mechanical Engineering  
2014 - 2019 
Grade: 2:1 IMech E accredited degree  with modules including project quality and production 
management, design analysis, dynamic analysis and control , thermofluids, aerodynamics and

2012 -2014 – Modules including industrial robots, electrical machines, further 
engineering math  and three phase electrical systems

Project Management,

to manage teams and scope

Sports  – Active gym member with a  passion for weightlifting and medium distance running. Participated in 50+ Park runs and 10+ charity 
runs.  
Institute of Mechanical Engineers – Active member.   
Project Management – APM PMQ qualified with the ambition of becoming a chartered project manager.  
PROJECTS  
Thornton and Ross — Manufacturing/Packaging  
 
Project engineering internship/graduate in the Project engineering and continuous improvement department at Thornton and Ross ’s 
pharmaceutical manufacturing and packaging factory. Started as a project assistant during my industrial placement into my cur rent role as a 
Project Engineer/Manager.   
 
Fully Automated Creams Production Line (£4.4M)  
A programme of projects which included decommissioning of 2 production lines, re -location of an existing production line, installation of a 
new ISO grade 8 clean room, HVAC installation, component Rationalisation and finally the  design, install  and validation of a Fully Automated 
Creams Packaging Production Line.  
 
• F

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
